subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis (modified and improved from the original diagnosis by Chevrizov 1978 )

Thick sensilla on third antennomere and labial palps. Thoracic macrosetae with no less than 5+5 macrosetae on pronotum, 5+5 on mesonotum (1+1 medial posterior included), and 4+4 on metanotum (1+1 medial posterior included). Two dorsal macrosetae on metathoracic femora and one on tibia. Unequal elbowed claws with lateral crests without lateral processes. Urotergites V–VII with 4+4 posterior macrosetae and without lateral anterior macrosetae. Up to 6+6 macrosetae on first urosternite, 4+4 macrosetae on second to seventh urosternites, and 1+1 macrosetae on eighth urosternite.
